model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Classmates A, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Classmates A: I really enjoy being a carpenter. It's a very fulfilling job.
Classmates B: That's great to hear! How did you get into carpentry?
Classmates A: My dad was a carpenter, so I grew up around it. I started by helping him out when I was young, and then I began to really enjoy it myself.
Classmates B: That's awesome that you were able to learn from your dad and turn it into a career. Have you done any big projects lately?
Classmates A: Yeah, I just finished building a custom bookshelf for a client. It was a challenging project, but I'm really happy with how it turned out.
Classmates B: That's impressive! You must have a lot of skill to be able to build something like that.
Classmates A: Thanks! It definitely takes a lot of practice and attention to detail. But I find it really rewarding to see a finished product that I created with my own two hands.
Classmates B: I can imagine. It must also be nice to have a steady income from your work.

[MEMORY]
1. Classmate A supports the President and believes he is doing a good job. This aligns with Classmates A appreciating the support and encouragement from Classmates B, who in turn is supportive and encourages Classmate A to pursue their dream.
2. Classmate A mentions the President's policies to boost job growth as progress in the economy, leading to Classmates A being interested in entrepreneurship and signing up for a seminar on starting a business. This causes Classmates A to attend the seminar, excited about applying that knowledge to future plans, and wanting to explore singing, a passion that they never thought possible until now.
3. Classmate A supports the President and believes he is doing a good job, which is the same topic when Classmates A appreciates the support and encouragement from Classmates B. This leads to Classmates A wanting to get to know Classmates B better and become friends, and also considering reaching out to vocal coaches to improve singing skills.
